algorithm.name: AZURETRANSLATION
algorithm.description: Uses Azure Cognitive Services to perform translation.

properties.name: ACS_URL
properties.description: Base URL for the Azure Cognitive Services Endpoint. e.g. https://api.cognitive.microsofttranslator.com . Can also be provided by an environment variable with the same name. If both are provided, the job property is used. Note that the component was only tested against v3.0 of the API.

properties.name: ACS_SUBSCRIPTION_KEY
properties.description: Azure Cognitive Services subscription key. Can also be provided by an environment variable with the same name. If both are provided, the job property is used.

properties.name: FEED_FORWARD_PROP_TO_PROCESS
properties.description: Comma-separated list of property names indicating which properties in the feed-forward track or detection to consider translating. If the first property listed is present, then that property will be translated. If it's not, then the next property in the list is considered. At most, one property will be translated.

properties.name: TO_LANGUAGE
properties.description: The BCP-47 language code for language that the properties should be translated to. Please consult README to query Azure's supported list of BCP-47 codes for translation.

properties.name: FROM_LANGUAGE
properties.description: Optional property that indicates the source BCP-47 language code of the text (i.e. 'es' to translate from text confirmed to be in Spanish). When provided, it disables automatic language detection. If the text isn't actually the specified FROM_LANGUAGE, the translation endpoint returns the text unmodified.  Please consult README to query Azure's supported list of BCP-47 codes for translation.

properties.name: SUGGESTED_FROM_LANGUAGE
properties.description: Optional property that indicates the fallback source BCP-47 language code to use when automatic language detection fails (i.e. 'es' to translate text that is suspected to be in Spanish). The value from this property is only used when automatic language detection fails.  Please consult README to query Azure's supported list of BCP-47 codes for translation.

properties.name: CATEGORY
properties.description: An optional property specifying the category (domain) of the translation. This parameter is used to get translations from a customized system built with Custom Translator.

properties.name: STRIP_NEW_LINE_BEHAVIOR
properties.description: The translation endpoint treats newline characters as sentence boundaries. To prevent this newlines can be removed from the input text. Valid values are SPACE (replace with space character), REMOVE (remove newlines), NONE (leave newlines as they are), and GUESS (If source language is Chinese or Japanese use REMOVE, else use SPACE).

properties.name: DETECT_BEFORE_TRANSLATE
properties.description: Use the /detect endpoint to check if translation can be skipped because the text is already in TO_LANGUAGE.

properties.name: LANGUAGE_FEED_FORWARD_PROP
properties.description: Comma-separated list of property names indicating which properties in the feed-forward track or detection determine the language from which to translate. If the first property listed is present, then that property will be used. If it's not, then the next property in the list is considered. If none are present, fall back to FROM_LANGUAGE.

properties.name: SENTENCE_SPLITTER_CHAR_COUNT
properties.description: Integer value specifying maximum number of characters to process through sentence splitter.

properties.name: SENTENCE_MODEL
properties.description: Name of sentence segmentation model. Supported options are spaCy's multilingual `xx_sent_ud_sm` model and the Where's the Point (WtP) `wtp-bert-mini` model.

properties.name: SENTENCE_MODEL_CPU_ONLY
properties.description: If set to true, only use CPU resources for the sentence detection model. If set to False, allow sentence model to also use GPU resources (for Docker deployments, please consult README for more info).

properties.name: SENTENCE_MODEL_WTP_DEFAULT_ADAPTOR_LANGUAGE
properties.description: More advanced WTP models will require a target language. This property sets the default language to use for sentence splitting, unless `FROM_LANGUAGE`, `SUGGESTED_FROM_LANGUAGE`, or Azure language detection return a different, WtP-supported language option.

properties.name: SENTENCE_SPLITTER_INCLUDE_INPUT_LANG
properties.description: Specifies whether to pass input language to sentence splitter algorithm. Currently, only WtP supports model adjustments by input language.

actions.name: AZURE TRANSLATION (WITH FF REGION) ACTION
actions.description: Uses Azure Cognitive Services to perform translation on feed-forward tracks and detections.

actions.description: Uses Azure Cognitive Services to perform translation on a plain text file.
